title: viqas footballstatsdirect
description:
Viqas Hussain created the Football Stats Direct application which renders various soccer statistics, pulling them from official APIs and showing them in an AG Grid for Analysis. The Integrated Charts are enabled to allow users to create custom graphs from rendered data and Standalone charts are used for pre-coded charts. Viqas has released the source on Github so anyone can study the code to learn how to create a full stack app using AG Grid, RapidAPI and Firebase.

00:00 Viqas Hussain Introduction
01:06 FootballStatsDirect.com
02:28 Demo of Football Stats Direct
04:55 Open Sourced Code
05:14 Architecture
06:30 AG Grid Features Used
07:20 Filtering with Value Getters
08:38 Backend using RapidAPI
10:12 Integrated Charting
12:00 Standalone charts
14:45 Custom Cell Renderers
17:53 Code on Github
20:24 Online Resources
20:50 Outros

Links:

- https://footballstatsdirect.com
- http://viqas.co.uk/
- https://github.com/viqashussain?tab=repositories&q=football&type=&language=&sort=

title: 100% React Rendering, Avoiding Wasted Renders
description:
AG Grid and React play well together because the rendering engine for React is 100% React. Niall Crosby, CEO of AG Grid, demonstrates this in the video by looking in the React developer tools and you'll see how to use memoization effectively to avoid wasted renders.

00:00 AG Grid is 100% React
00:10 Starting Code Explained
00:25 Custom React Component
00:54 Developer Tools Rendering View
01:56 Wasted Renders Demonstration
03:00 Avoiding Waster Renders with memo
03:28 Summary

AG Grid works with React, Angular, Vue, and JavaScript. Available as a free community edition and commercially as an Enterprise product (full support and more features). 

For more information about AG Grid please visit: https://ag-grid.com/

title: Built-in column filters overview for the React Data Grid from AG Grid
description:
In this video Niall Crosby, CEO of AG Grid, provides an overview of the built-in column filters for AG Grid. This video uses the React Data Grid. Columns can be filtered to allow the user to configure the data shown in the grid. Three filters are supplied with AG Grid community edition: text, number and date. An additional set and multi filter are available to the enterprise edition. The filters can also be configured through the API.

00:00 about filters
00:20 default filters
00:55 text, number and date filters
02:38 filter parameters
03:55 filter buttons
05:45 filtering by dates
06:30 filter state models
09:18 floating filters
10:10 Enterprise filters
12:43 Filter Menu Container
13:35 Summary

Learn more about Column Filtering for AG Grid's React Data Grid:

https://www.ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/filtering/

AG Grid works with React, Angular, Vue, and JavaScript. Available as a free community edition and commercially as an Enterprise product (full support and more features).

title: AdaptableTools Extension Add-On Library For AG Grid Demo and Interview with Jonny Wolfson
description:
In this video Jonny Wolfson, CTO of Adaptable Tools, provides a demo of the AdapTable  AG Grid extension library that adds a massive amount of extra features focussed on the end user of applications written with AG Grid. For example, if you want user to be able to write complex queries to filter data or create their own calculated cells then check out Adaptable Tools. The demo application shows what it is possible to achieve in a single day of coding.

https://www.adaptabletools.com/

00:00 What is Adaptable Tools?
03:10 Version 11 Updates
04:08 Demo Application Overview
07:00 Action, Free Text and Calculated Columns
10:45 Settings Panel
14:40 Building on AG Grid
15:40 The Dashboard
16:30 Custom Queries
17:41 Audit History
18:25 Custom Reports
18:49 Excel Report Scheduling and Synchronisation
20:05 Alerts for Data Change
24:38 User Configured Cell Rendering
27:50 No Code Grid Configuration
29:30 Features Overview
30:30 Consultancy
31:20 Client Side and Server Side Row Model Support
32:30 Custom Query Functions
34:20 visit adaptabletools.com
34:45 End Notes


In the video we discover:

- What is Adaptable?
- What does it add on top of AG Grid?
     - making it easier for end users to access some of the customisations that are via the API with the raw AG Grid
- What's new in version 11
    - setting panel
    - react ui
- Show in action with the Github Issues example
    - https://issuelog-demo.adaptabletools.com/
- Cover some major features
    - settings panel
         - add custom settings 
    - dashboard
    - Toolpanel - extended version of AG Grid's
    - Column menus - extended version of AG Grid's
    - Context menu - extended version of AG Grid's
    - Editing Extensions
        - bulk editing, smart editing 
    - Calculated Columns
    - Expression editor
    - Excel Synchronisation and custom exports
    - Custom column formatting
    - Query Language
    - Alerts
    - No Code configuration to allow end users to create their own grids
    - Easy integration with OpenFin and ipushpull

title: Customising Cells with React Components as Cell Renderers
description:
Customising cells using React Cell Renderers, these are simple functions that return JSX to add your own React component to format and add interactivity to the cells in a data grid. These can be created as functional components, anonymous inline functions or class components.

04:04 Inline Components

05:38 Cell Renderer Selector
07:00 Summary

title: Quickstart Tutorial for the React Data Grid from AG Grid
description:
This video is a quick start tutorial to getting started with AG Grid in a React project. Niall Crosby, the CEO and creator of AG Grid walks you through the basic knowledge needed to work with AG Grid using React. You'll see how to create a project, add AG Grid. You'll understand what CSS is used to style and structure the grid. How to use state and effect to manage data in the grid while loading data from the server. Sorting and Filtering is demonstrated through specific and default column properties. Grid Properties are used to animate rows and support selection. Adding functionality to the grid can be implemented by hooking into the grid events and using the API.


00:00 Create a Project
00:18 Add AG Grid
00:30 Get Started
00:46 Create an AG Grid
02:00 CSS Includes Explained
02:33 Adding data to the grid
03:20 Using React State for data
03:52 Loading data from server with useEffect
04:32 Sorting and Filtering Columns
05:00 Default Column Definitions
05:50 Grid properties to animate and select rows
06:28 hooking into Grid Events
07:15 using the Grid API
08:18 Summary
08:38 Outro

https://www.ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/

The new React UI benefits developers by integrating more tightly into the React ecosystem and developer tooling

title: New Release Overview for AG Grid version 27 - 100% React Data Grid, and more...
description:
The new version of AG Grid makes the 100% React Rendering Engine the default for React Projects. Vue, Angular and JavaScript projects are still supported as those frameworks have their own dedicated rendering engines.

The documentation has been updated to have react best practices and fully typed examples in TypeScript as well as JavaScript.

title: Get started with React Data Grid - Free Community and Enterprise Editions
description:
This getting started video follows the React Data Grid tutorial in our documentation:

https://www.ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/getting-started/

The video walks you through the process of installing the free open source community edition of AG Grid and using it with React to create a basic grid. To this grid we add sorting, filtering, and row selection. We use the API to access content in the grid and load content from an HTTP API GET request. Using the enterprise edition we enable more grid features like improved filtering and context menu and then add row grouping.

In this video you'll learn:

00:00 an overview of AG Grid
00:24 installing free community edition for React JS
01:19 create a simple react data grid
02:34 adding Sortable Columns
03:00 Filter and Search Columns
03:14 Loading Data From HTTP or API call
04:00 Selectable Rows and Grid API

05:50 improved filters and context menu
06:20 row grouping
07:23 overview of basic features

title: Code a Podcast Player App in React with AG Grid - How to Build Application Tutorial Part 2
description:
In the second part of this build a React app tutorial we will code a Podcast Player, using the AG Grid community edition. The podcast player will be enhanced to support filtering, searching, pagination and a list of podcasts to choose from. We will also cover the difference between managed and unmanaged components in React.

Part 1 of this tutorial is here: 
https://youtu.be/2TDIWOubvp0

Blog post describing this tutorial here:

https://blog.ag-grid.com/how-to-write-a-podcast-app-using-react/

Code for this tutorial is available on Github:

https://github.com/ag-grid/react-data-grid

In the podcast-player folder.

https://github.com/ag-grid/react-data-grid/tree/main/podcast-player

AG Grid works with React, Angular, Vue, and JavaScript. Available as a free community edition and commercially as an Enterprise product (full support and more features). 

For more information about AG Grid please visit: https://ag-grid.com/

title: Code a Podcast Player App in React with AG Grid - How to Build Application Tutorial Part 1
description:
In this tutorial we will build a Podcast Player App, using React and AG Grid community edition. Learn to code a functioning podcast application with this coding example. The podcast player will fetch a feed URL and parse the XML RSS feed, load the episode data in the grid and use an embedded audio player to play the episode.

Part 2 of this tutorial is here: https://youtu.be/rsamoG6bD4Y

This tutorial was written using Version 26 of AG Grid. If you want to follow along with the tutorial video then install AG Grid as

npm install --save ag-grid-community@26.0.0 ag-grid-react@26.0.0

The blog post below has a section explaining the changes I made to the cellRenderer code to use the cellRenderer changes in version 27 of AG Grid. (I returned JSX instead of an HTML string)

Blog post describing this tutorial here:

https://blog.ag-grid.com/how-to-write-a-podcast-app-using-react/

Code for this tutorial is available on Github:

https://github.com/ag-grid/react-data-grid

In the podcast-player folder.

https://github.com/ag-grid/react-data-grid/tree/main/podcast-player

title: Add Charts to a JavaScript Data Grid in less than 20 seconds
description:
AG Grid has many 1 line configuration options. One of the most powerful is the option to enable Charts in the Enterprise version.

This video shows How to enable integrated charts on JavaScript Data Grid in less than 20 Seconds using AG Grid

enableCharts: true

This demo shows what can be achieved when the charts are enabled.

For more information about integrated charts visit:

https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/integrated-charts/

title: Optimize React Data Grid for Hooks from AG Grid
description:
Learn how to optimise the React Data Grid with React Hooks. When we create components on top of AG Grid we may introduce code that increases the number of renders. AG Grid itself is optimised, we need to make sure the we use around AG Grid is optimised. This video explains optimizations using react memoization, arrays to define basis for re-rendering.

Recommended Practices:

- Memoize Constant Data
- Add 2nd Parameter to useEffect to define a state, or prop, or [] to run once
- Use objects instead of declarative JSX

00:00 Introduction
00:30 useEffect Parameters
00:50 objects instead of declarative JSX
02:54 Memoization
03:55 Summary
04:09 Outro

https://blog.ag-grid.com/getting-started-with-react-hooks-and-ag-grid-in-5-minutes

title: AG Grid Features Overview
description:
Ag-Grid offers a feature set, performance and quality not seen before in a JavaScript datagrid.
Over 1,200,000 monthly downloads and used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500. Ag-Grid has become *the* datagrid for JavaScript developers. Fully supported and available for JavaScript, Angular, React and Vue. https://ag-grid.com Subscribe to our channel to quickly learn how to use ag-Grid!

A data grid is a table of data rendered using div's rather than table elements or a css grid layout.

title: Embed JavaScript Data Grid - Master / Detail with ag-Grid
description:
AG Grid Enterprise has the ability to render grids within grids. This allows you to expand parent rows to show child tables of data, these can be fully customised with different formatting based on the parent row data.

The ability to embed or nest grids within grids makes complex data layout simple without having to create complex HTML table layouts.

title: ag-Grid Integrated Charts
Javascript Charting for Data Grid
description:
AG Grid has integrated charting built in. The grid comes with charting integration allowing users to chart data directly from the grid without requiring additional developer coding.

The charting functionality is deeply integrated with the grid. This integration gives users a seamless charting experience while keeping the coding required by developers to a minimum.

A seamless charting experience while keeping the coding required by developers to a minimum.

Standalone charts are available as well as integrated charting.

Integrated Charts demonstrated in this video: https://www.ag-grid.com/react-grid/integrated-charts/

title: Building a Complex High Performance JavaScript Project
description:
How do you build a complex JavaScript project? And make it High Performance? In this video Niall Crosby gives away the secrets to creating a high performance JavaScript Data Grid that supports multiple JavaScript Frameworks. Presented at AG Grid Conf in 2018.

Design decisions and insights into how the architecture of AG Grid was created. The challenges of building a component like ag-Grid, the internal framework ag-Grid now uses, and how to best squeeze ag-Grid for performance.

- What makes writing your own data table and grid hard?
- How to write your own IoC engine
- Avoid external framework dependencies
- How to make rendering fast and harness GPU
- Auto Generating Examples for Documentation in Multiple JavaScript Frameworks
- Use of a Mono Repo with Lerna
- Role of a Developer and Development Approach

title: How can a JavaScript Data Grid Support Any Framework?
description:
Sean Landsman, ag-Grid's frameworks guru looks in-depth at ag-Grid's continued support for all the popular JavaScript frameworks.

00:00 Intro
00:28 History of AG Grid Framework Support
01:30 Framework Adoption Rates
02:30 Trends
04:00 React Support
07:00 Polymer Support
09:00 Framework Agnostic

ag-Grid has zero dependencies such as Angular or React, we don’t even use JQuery, Underscore or LoDash. The foundations of ag-Grid is a custom made framework designed specifically for ag-Grid. Having no dependency means ag-Grid will work with any framework — we call this framework agnostic.

Being framework agnostic allows you to choose your framework and data grid separately. It also reduces the work required when you move frameworks (e.g. moving from Angular 1 to Angular, VueJS or React to Aurelia etc.).

If you choose a data grid that is not framework agnostic (e.g. written using Angular) then you have locked into that framework. If you select a data grid you should not be locked into a framework.

We are not aware of any other data grid that is agnostic like ag-Grid.

AG Grid is available as a free community edition and commercially as an Enterprise product (full support and more features). AG Grid works with React, Angular, Vue, and JavaScript.

For more information about AG Grid please visit: https://ag-grid.com

title: History and Mission of AG Grid
description:
Niall Crosby, CEO of ag-Grid delivering his keynote for ag-Grid Conf London 2018. 

Niall covers the birth and growth of ag-Grid from 2015. Starting as a side-project, to the defacto Angular Grid and then moving to become the defacto grid for all frameworks. 


00:00 Intro
00:20 History of AG Grid
01:16 npm downloads increase
02:00 Company Growth
03:20 Framework Support
04:30 "The Best" Grid
05:10 Enterprise and Big Data
06:50 The Team
07:15 Outro

Three years have seen quite the growth all across ag-Grid. The grid now gets over 150,000 downloads a month, developing a strong presence within the community and the Enterprise version(paid) is now used by over 1,500 companies, over 25% of the Fortune 500 and by many of the top investment banks in the world. 

The customer base isn't the only section of the company that has seen growth. The company has grown from 1 to 15 within three years and is ever growing.

title: 4 Simple Steps to Create a Ticket | ag-Grid x Zendesk
description:
This video details how to create a ticket on AG Grid Zendesk from start to finish.  Enterprise support for AG Grid is provided using ZenDesk, if you are an enterprise customer, contact us for access to ZenDesk.

Transcript.

After signing up you will receive a ‘Welcome’ email from ag-Grid Enterprise support

1. Set your ‘Password’ using the link in the email
2. ‘Sign In’ to the support forum
3. Click ’Submit a Request’ to create a ticket
4. Fill the ticket form with:
- Subject
- Description
- Framework
- Version
Following these steps, you will receive an email confirming your ticket reached the support team
5. You have successfully submitted your ticket!

Subscribe to stay up to date with all our video content.

title: Server Side Row Model for JavaScript Data Grid
description:
When our Server Side row model was originally introduced it was called the Enterprise Row Model. The current Server Side Model is an improved version of the implementation explained in this video and you can find more detail in the documentation. https://www.ag-grid.com/react-grid/server-side-model/

The server side model allows all data to be loaded from the server, with full support for dynamic grouping, aggregation and charting.
